text:
I host a show where I ask people unusual questions (Not your typical questions with Hashem). Any tips or thoughts on how I can improve either the actual videos or the Linkedin posts in the future? Here's an example of a compilation and an individual clip
<https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6910974964732981248/>
<https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6906959011842027521/>

elements.text: I host a show where I ask people unusual questions (Not your typical questions with Hashem). Any tips or thoughts on how I can improve either the actual videos or the Linkedin posts in the future? Here's an example of a compilation and an individual clip

text:
So bummed to have missed this AMA! But our agency is starting to talk about web3 with clients and internally focusing on education so that we're prepared to talk about it with clients. Some clients are like, "set up a Discord! Make us an NFT!" which feels a lot like <https://twitter.com/dongtent/status/1467941579444801538|this tweet>.

There's obviously a lot of skepticism and general wariness around web3 from different teams, as well as varying experience/knowledge levels. But it's great that we're all starting to talk about it, learn more, and answer client questions in a knowledgeable way

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/dongtent|@dongtent>: clients love asking for two things

1. a tiktok challenge
2. how does tiktok work
